intro: Erigeron sodiroi, commonly known as the Mexican fleabane, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It produces showy, daisy-like flowers with white petals and a yellow center, which bloom in the summer months. Erigeron sodiroi is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
